bibl.title: Ägypten in der Selbstdarstellung der Flavier. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Examines the relation of all three Flavian emperors to Egypt and Egyptian cults. Demonstrates that Egypt actually was less important for the Flavian dynasty as assumed by some modern historians and that Vespasian's relationship to Egyptian gods was much closer than that of Domitian. - 1. Vespasian. - 2. Titus. - 3. Domitian. - 4. Ergebnisse.

bibl.title: Tradition und Erneuerung. Mediale Strategien in der Zeit der Flavier

bibl.seg: PFEIFFER Stefan, Ägypten in der Selbstdarstellung der Flavier. Avec résumé en anglais.
Norbert KRAMER und Christiane REITZ (Hgg.), Tradition und Erneuerung. Mediale Strategien in der Zeit der Flavier (Berlin - New York, 2010) pp. 273-288.

Examines the relation of all three Flavian emperors to Egypt and Egyptian cults. Demonstrates that Egypt actually was less important for the Flavian dynasty as assumed by some modern historians and that Vespasian's relationship to Egyptian gods was much closer than that of Domitian. - 1. Vespasian. - 2. Titus. - 3. Domitian. - 4. Ergebnisse.
